item.title: Esteban Veliz
item.description: {{< columns >}} This is column 1. {{< column >}} This is column 2. {{< endcolumn >}} I am currently in the Sundaresan lab at UC Davis studying how rice roots assemble a microbiome. One of my main long-term goals is to develop a microbiome-informed agronomy taking into account the evolutionary and ecological complexity of how plants and microbiota dynamically interact. Some of my research interests include: The rhizosphere effect and plant immune interactions with microbiota.

item.title: front
item.description: I study how agricultural root microbiomes assemble, focusing on processes and mechanisms that can inform the development of appropriate tools for sustainable intensive agriculture.
